summary: Build D’ZETA Space (farm-to-table cafe) app with customer digital menu + cart, admin inventory, event booking, and backend logic for real-time stock/supply-chain deductions, including QR table flow and e-wallet/WhatsApp ordering.
architectural_notes: Frontend prototype target: React/Next.js + Tailwind CSS, mobile-responsive; serif headings + sans-serif body styling
System needs real-time stock linkage between menu ordering and inventory (warehouse location support)
known_issues: Build/deploy attempt failed previously ('Our AI couldn't handle that request'); user requested to rebuild

existing_features.title: Make the project build and deploy successfully by resolving any compile-time or runtime integration errors between the React frontend and the Motoko backend (Candid/actor method mismatches, missing exports, type mismatches, or route initialization issues).

Ensure the backend exposes and the frontend can call all admin-related APIs required by the existing admin UI: isCallerAdmin, getAdminOrdersQueue, getAdminAnalytics, and any access-control initialization method invoked by the frontend actor initialization.

new_feature_requests.summary: Customer-facing digital menu with product categories and product cards, including Add to Cart
Admin Inventory page showing real-time stock by location (e.g., 'Gudang Lantai 1')
Event booking feature with booking form (e.g., Intimate Wedding, Family Gathering) and date availability for 2nd floor/backyard
QR-code table flow to open the menu for customers
Payments integration via e-wallet in the customer order flow
Supply-chain inventory deduction logic: selling products deducts ingredient stock (e.g., flour, yeast)
Order via WhatsApp integration button from the ordering flow
Define database schema for Users, Products, Inventory, Orders, Bookings to support app workflows

Verify and harden the initial admin bootstrap flow so that at least one admin can be assigned after deployment using the existing secureBootAdmin mechanism, without requiring code edits, and ensure the flow is compatible with the frontend’s admin token handling.
